title: How do decomposers help make the soil fertile? - Quora

response.answer_text: Decomposers are microorganism ( bacteria, fungi, protozoa, nematode) which are present in the soil, which decomposes dead plant and animals and create humus. When humus is present in soil then the soil is fertile. The roots of any plant take all the nutrients through this humus. Humus creation is happened in the top most 3″ layer of the top soil. When we apply too much synthetic fertilizers all the decomposers are dead. We have to incorporated decomposers manually or if you leave the land ideal for 1–2 yrs, decomposers will be incorporated automatically.
